events.event_description: Natural gas production from the three largest US tight oil plays (Bakken, Eagle Ford, and Permian) has significantly increased, now comprising 40% of total production compared to 29% in 2014.
events.citation: Natural gas produced from the three largest tight oil-producing plays in the United States has increased in the last decade. Natural gas comprised 40% of total production from the Bakken, the Eagle Ford, and the Permian compared with 29% in 2014.

events.event_description: The Permian play has seen natural gas production increase eight-fold and crude oil production increase six-fold through September 2024 compared to 2014, with GOR rising from 3.1 Mcf/b to 4.0 Mcf/b.
events.citation: Natural gas production in the Permian, the largest producing tight oil play in the United States, increased eight-fold in 2024 through September compared with 2014, and crude oil production increased six-fold.

events.event_description: The Bakken play experienced a 186% increase in natural gas production while crude oil production only increased 14%, with GOR rising from 1.2 Mcf/b to 2.9 Mcf/b.
events.citation: However, the GOR increased to 2.9 Mcf/b (33%) in 2024, with average gross natural gas production increasing 186% compared with 2014 while crude oil production increased just 14%.

events.event_description: Eagle Ford play showed a 14% increase in natural gas production and a 28% decrease in crude oil production, with GOR rising from 3.5 Mcf/b to 5.6 Mcf/b.
events.citation: This increased GOR reflects a 14% increase in average natural gas production and a 28% decrease in average crude oil production in 2024 through September compared with 2014.
